title: Clone a Repository
description: The 'git clone' command copies a remote repository to your local machine.
story: Tom wants to contribute to a project Jerry is working on. He uses 'git clone' to copy the repository to his computer.

game.hint: Use 'git clone' followed by the repository URL to copy it locally.

title: Add a Remote Repository
description: The 'git remote add' command connects a local repository to a remote repository.
story: Jerry wants to connect his local repository to a GitHub repository. He uses 'git remote add' to link them.

game.hint: Use 'git remote add' to connect a remote repository.

title: Pull Changes from Remote
description: The 'git pull' command fetches and integrates changes from a remote repository.
story: Tom wants to get the latest updates from the remote repository. He uses 'git pull' to fetch and merge changes.

game.hint: Use 'git pull' followed by the remote name and branch to fetch updates.

title: Push Changes to Remote
description: The 'git push' command uploads local changes to a remote repository.
story: Jerry wants to share his changes with the team. He uses 'git push' to upload them to the remote repository.

game.hint: Use 'git push' followed by the remote name and branch to upload changes.

title: Fetch Updates from Remote
description: The 'git fetch' command retrieves changes from a remote repository but does not merge them.
story: Tom wants to check for updates from the remote repository without merging them. He uses 'git fetch'.

game.hint: Use 'git fetch' followed by the remote name to retrieve updates.

title: View Remote Repositories
description: The 'git remote -v' command shows the remote repositories associated with the local repository.
story: Jerry wants to verify the remote repositories linked to his project. He uses 'git remote -v'.

game.hint: Run 'git remote -v' to view remote repositories.

title: Track a Remote Branch
description: The 'git push --set-upstream' command sets the current branch to track a remote branch.
story: Jerry creates a new branch locally and wants to push it to the remote repository. He uses 'git push --set-upstream'.

game.hint: Use 'git push --set-upstream' to set a branch to track a remote branch.

title: Remove a Remote Repository
description: The 'git remote remove' command removes a connection to a remote repository.
story: Jerry no longer needs the connection to a remote repository. He removes it using 'git remote remove'.

game.hint: Use 'git remote remove' to disconnect a remote repository.
